bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, May 1, 1890

div1.p: Kellogg states that Reed is a man of marked ability. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, May 1, 1890
div1.p: (Officer's individual report--under G. O. 41, A. G. O., 1890.)

Post Mount Vernon Barracks,
Ala,
May 1st, 1890.
To the ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
SIR: I have the honor to report that I have given attention to the following special subjects:
1. In the line of the military profession. None

2. Professional or scientific study other than military. None other than
that embraced in my own profession.
4. Other special courses of reading, study, or investigation. None

Respectfully submitted.
Walter Reed,
Asst. Surg, U.S.A.

NOTE.--If the officer has nothing to report, he will so state. Under “Remarks” give progress, method of study or investigation, length of time
occupied, results obtained, &c. If a foreign language has been studied, state whether reading or speaking knowledge has been obtained.
Rank, Regiment or corps.} Maj Asst. Surg.

Made by
1. Himself May 1, 90.
2. C.O. Mt. Vernon Bks May 1, 90.
Remarks:

Name: Walter Reed,
Rank, regiment, or corps.} Capt., Med. Dept.
2/4683 Wri. alte. 1890.
Reported by Major W. L. Kellogg.
Comdg. Mr. Vernon Barracks,
Alabama
Date: May 1st, 1890.

Attention to duty: Excellent.
Conduct and habits: "
Discipline, &c.: "
Care of men: "
Special duty fitted for: a man of
marked ability
Special duty performed, and how:
none
Special studies pursued: none
Remarks: none

First Indorsement
Mr. Vernon Barracks, Ala.,
May 1st, 1890.

Respectfully forwarded to the
Assistant Adjutant General,
Division of the Atlantic.
W.L. Kellogg
Major 19th Infantry,
Commanding.
EFFICIENCY REPORT IN CASE OF
Name: Walter Reed,
Rank, regiment, or corps.} Capt. Med. Dept.
1/4683 Wri. alte. 1890.
Reported by himself.
Place: Mr. Vernon Bks, Ala.
Date: May 1st, 1890

Special subjects studied: Those only
embraced in his
own profession
Languages: none
Business training: none
Remarks: none

First Indorsement
Mt. Vernon Barracks, Ala.
May 1st, 1890,
Respectfully forwarded to the
Assistant Adjutant General
Division of the Atlantic
